params.name: reservationLocationId
params.doc: ID of the ReservationLocation to retrieve.

docs.summary: Retrieves a reservation location by ID.
Retrieves a list of up to 100 reservation locations.
Retrieves a list of reservation locations given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting. Up to 100 reservation locations can be returned per request.
description:
For a detailed list of supported operations, see the [Supported filters and sorting](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-restaurants/reservations/reservation-locations/supported-filters-and-sorting) article.
To learn how to query reservation locations, see [API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language).

docs.summary: Updates a reservation location. Supports partial updates.
description:
Each time the reservation location is updated, revision increments by 1. The existing revision must be included when updating the reservation location. This ensures you're working with the latest reservation location information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.

You cannot use this endpoint to change a reservation location's `location` object. Attempting to do so will cause the server to return an application error.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: 2-letter country code in an [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: formatted
members.doc: Full address of the location.

members.name: location
members.doc: Geographic coordinates of the location.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Postal or zip code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address of the location. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude of the location. Must be between -90 and 90.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude of the location. Must be between -180 and 180.

description: Address geolocation information.

If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: eventTime

members.name: originatedFrom

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.doc:
Whether the checkbox is checked by default.

Default: `false`

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether the checkbox is shown to the customer.

Default: `false`

description: Email marketing checkbox.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: number
members.doc: The quantity of the chosen time unit.

members.name: unit
members.doc: Time unit.

description: Reservation notice period.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
The location's business schedule.
A business schedule is an operational timetable of the business. It is represented by an array of weekly recurring time periods when the location is open for business. The business schedule is limited to 100 time periods.

By default, the business schedule of a reservation location will use the values of its location's business schedule. However, after the first time a reservation location's business schedule has been modified, it will store and use its own values and no longer mirror its location's business schedule.

members.name: defaultTurnoverTime
members.doc:
Default time in minutes for party turnover.

Party turnover is how much time a party is allotted for their entire reservation - from being seated to leaving the restaurant.

members.name: manualApproval
members.doc: Manual approval settings.

members.name: minimumReservationNotice
members.doc:
Minimum reservation notice.

The minimum amount of time that must be allowed between making a reservation and that reservation's start time.

members.name: onlineReservationsEnabled
members.doc: Whether online reservations are enabled.

members.name: partyPacing
members.doc:
Party pacing settings.

The maximum number of party reservations that can start within a 15-minute period.
For example, a party pacing of 5 would mean that no more than 5 parties could make a reservation for the period between 10:00.000-10:14.999.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Party size limits for a reservation.

members.name: seatPacing
members.doc:
Seat pacing settings.

The maximum number of seats that can be filled by new reservations within a 15-minute period.
For example, setting a seat pacing of 15 would mean that between 10:00.000-10:14.999 there will be no more than 15 new seats available for reservation.

members.name: showPhoneNumber
members.doc: Whether a phone number is shown.

members.name: turnoverTimeRules
members.doc:
Custom turnover time rules.

This allows you to set different turnover times for different party sizes.

members.name: location
members.doc:
Physical location details.

Locations can be created and configured using the [Locations API](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/business-info/locations/introduction)
or on the [Business Info](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Fsettings/business-info) page in the Dashboard.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of a reservation location. Each time the reservation location is modified, its `revision` changes. For an update operation to succeed, you must pass the latest revision.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether this option is enabled.

members.name: number
members.doc: Max number of seats that can be reserved every 15 minutes.

description:
Seat pacing.
The maximum number of seats that can be filled by new reservations within a 15-minute period.
For example, setting a seat pacing of 15 would mean that between 10:00.000-10:14.999 there will be no more than 15 new seats available for reservation.

members.name: originMetaSiteId
members.doc:
A meta site id from which this site was created.

In case of a creation from a template it's a template id.
In case of a site duplication ("Save As" in dashboard or duplicate in UM) it's an id of a source site.

description: Soft deletion of the meta site. Could be restored.
Hard deletion of the meta site.
First publish of a meta site. Or subsequent publish after unpublish.
Rename of the site. Meaning, free public url has been changed as well.

members.name: newOwnerId
members.doc: A new owner id (user that accepts meta site).

members.name: oldOwnerId
members.doc: A previous owner id (user that transfers meta site).

description: Site transferred to another user.
Restoration of the meta site.

Sort order.

Use `ASC` for ascending order or `DESC` for descending order. Defaults to `ASC`.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time this period ends in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

This is the last time a reservation can be made at the restaurant, not the time the restaurant closes its doors.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time this period starts in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

description:
A span of time that the business is open,
starting on the specified open day/time and closing on the specified close day/time.
Closing time must occur after the opening time, for example later in the same day, or on a subsequent day.

members.name: maxSeats
members.doc: Max number of seats to qualify for this rule.

members.name: minSeats
members.doc: Min number of seats to qualify for this rule.

members.name: minutes
members.doc: Turnover time in minutes for qualifying parties.

description: Turnover rule. A turnover time is defined per party size range.

members.name: minutes
members.doc: Turnover time in minutes for qualifying parties.

members.name: seatsMax
members.doc: Max number of seats to qualify for this rule.

members.name: seatsMin
members.doc: Min number of seats to qualify for this rule.

description: Turnover time rule. A turnover time is defined per party size range.

members.doc: Represents the current state of a reservation location. Each time the reservation location is modified, its `revision` changes. For an update operation to succeed, you must pass the latest revision.
